transcript.title: GOVERNMENT PARTIES NEW COMMITTEE SYSTEM
transcript.content:
F76/ 53 6
, CSTALIA
' FOR PRESS 18 March 1976
. G. O. VEP: NNjENT* PARTIES NEW COMMITTEE SYSTEM
The Government Parties' new committee system began operating
this week.
There are* 13 Standing Committees covering all Ministerial
areas, and two special committees dealing with electoral
tactics and Parliamentary reform. Details of the committees
are attached.
The new arrangements recommended by a committee appointed
under the chairmanship of Senator F. M. Chaney are designed
to givp Liberal and National Country Party Members and
Senators maximum opportunity to contribute to the processes
of government.
The committees will examine legislation and assist with the
development of policy. In actively seeking to forge and mrain"% ain
outside links, the coirnittees will also play an important
part in the two-way channel of communication between the
Government and the community at large. They will consult
with representatives of relevant outside bodies, and also with the
respective Party organisations. The Secretariats of the
Government Parties will assist with the servicing of the new
committee system.
The committees will report to the Party Room after consultation
with appropriate Ministers. In some cases, the final review
of Bills will take place at meetings convened by the Standing
Committees rather than in the full Joint Party Meeting.

The committees' work will be co-ordinated by a
" Chairman's Group", chaired by Senator Chaney, and comprising
the chairmen of the various committees.
The committees can play a positive and constructive part in
good government. In particular, they will enable the
Government to get maximum value from the considerable reservoir
of talent and experience on its large backbench.
000ooo000

COMMUNICATIONS ADMINIST
